isis.stitle: MULTI-LINK FRONT AIR SUSPENSION - REMOVE AND INSTALL PROCEDURES - TORQUE RODS

note.para: The lower torque rods must be replaced one at a time. This will keep the axle from rotating out of position.
It is recommended the vehicle be unloaded prior to performing this procedure. Vehicle must be at approximate air spring height.
Place a reference mark on the torque rod, at the rear of the sway bar, to aid in alignment of the sway bar during installation procedures.

step1.para: Remove four nuts, bolts, and sway bar clamps from the lower torque rod ( Figure 14).
Remove two locknuts and washers from the lower torque rod and two axle mount bracket studs.
Remove two bolts and nuts from the mega bracket and lower torque rod.
To remove the lower torque rod, slide the lower torque rod off the two axle mount bracket studs.

caution.para: When tightening bolts on torque rod to specifications, the vehicle must be at proper ride height to avoid introducing unnecessary stress on the torque rod bushings.

step1.para: Slide the lower torque rod onto the two axle mount bracket studs ( Figure 17, Items 1 and 5).
Install two bolts and nuts on the mega bracket and lower torque rod ( Figure 17). Torque bolts to 195 to 240 lbf-ft (265 to 325 N•m).
Secure the lower torque rod to the axle mount bracket studs with two washers and locknuts ( Figure 17). Torque locknuts to 170 to 185 lbf-ft (230 to 251 N•m).
Secure the sway bar to the lower torque rod with two sway bar clamps, bolts and nuts ( Figure 14). Do not tighten bolts at this time.

note.para: When properly installed, a gap will be present along both the bottom and top of each sway bar clamp.

step1.para: Follow these steps to secure the sway bar clamps ( Figure 16):

item.para: Install two sway bar clamps on each side of sway bar and install two bolts and nuts on each sway bar clamp.
Tighten all bolts, making sure that a gap is shown at top and bottom of each sway bar clamp.
Torque each sway bar clamp by first torquing the bottom bolt and then the top. Torque bolts to 80 to 100 lbf-ft (108 to 135 N•m).

step1.para: Check axle caster and adjust as needed (refer to FRONT AXLE CASTER).

note.para: The upper torque rods must be replaced one at a time. This will keep the axle from rotating out of position.
It is recommended the vehicle be unloaded prior to performing this procedure. Vehicle must be at approximate air spring height.

step1.para: Remove bolt and nut from the mega bracket and upper torque rod.
Remove bolt and nut from the axle mount bracket and upper torque rod.

caution.para: When tightening bolts on torque rod to specifications, the vehicle must be at proper ride height to avoid introducing unnecessary stress on the torque rod bushings.

step1.para: Align the upper torque rod on the axle mount bracket and the mega bracket ( Figure 18, Items 2, 3, and 5).
Install bolt and nut to secure the upper torque rod to the axle mount bracket ( Figure 18). Torque bolt to 300 to 370 lbf-ft (407 to 502 N•m).
Install bolt and nut to secure the upper torque rod to the mega bracket ( Figure 18). Torque bolt to 300 to 370 lbf-ft (407 to 502 N•m).
Check axle caster and adjust as needed (refer to FRONT AXLE CASTER).
